text: hello my name is Joe Wright and I'm the
director of Hanna so Hanna in this scene
is coming into contact with 20th century
technology or gadgets for the first time
she's never seen electricity or
telephones or the electric kettle or any
of these things so when she reaches out
to the the electric kettle she doesn't
know it's going to be hot she's kind of
like a baby we had to kind of wipe her
brain free of everything the kettle has
actually been operated by a guy
underneath the desk with a piece of
string to create that movement and in
fact the whole room is being kind of
operated by I think four or five crew
members hidden in various but someone's
operating the ceiling fan on a separate
switch there
she's never you know used a remote
control before and so she assumes that
if the remote control works for the TV
it will also work for a telephone
there's another guy underneath the desk
there with a piece of string operating
the telephone it's conceived as a single
shot so that the camera moves 360
degrees around so as she's performing
the scene a tough job for the focus
puller but I kind of almost like a piece
of puppetry it was it was a whole the
whole room was a kind of big automated
machine really
